contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=May 2013}} : ''For other uses, see [[Zenit (disambiguation)]].'' [[Image:VSS Zenit Emblem.png|thumb|150px|The emblem of the VSS Zenit]] '''Zenit''' ({{lang-ru|Зенит}}; meaning [[zenith]]) was the [[All-Union]] [[Voluntary Sports Societies of the USSR|Voluntary Sports Society]] for workers of [[arms industry]], established in 1936. Due to reorganization of sports societies, between 1957 and 1966 physical culture collectives of Zenit were a part of VSS Trud from the [[Russian SFSR]], and other republican sports societies. In 1966 Zenit again became a separate VSS. In the 1970s Zenit had about 1,000 large sports constructions, 13,000 sports and football grounds, more than 100 [[Children and Youth Sport School]]s. The name has been retained after the fall of the Soviet Union and the VSS system, notably by [[FC Zenit Saint Petersburg]], which won the [[Russian Premier League 2007|2007]] and [[Russian Premier League 2010|2010 Russian Premier League]] seasons, the [[UEFA Cup 2007-08|2007-08 UEFA Cup]], and the [[2008 UEFA Super Cup]] in [[association football]]. ==Notable members== *[[Yelena Davydova]] ([[artistic gymnastics]]) *[[Anatoly Mikhailov]] ([[Athletics (track and field)|athletics]]) *[[Mariya Pisareva]] (athletics) *[[Tamara Tyshkevich]] (athletics) *[[Galina Zybina]] (athletics) *[[Vladimir Nikitin]] ([[cross-country skiing]]) *[[Larisa Selezneva]] ([[figure skating]]) *[[Anatoli Fedyukin]] ([[team handball|handball]]) *[[Lyudmila Titova]] ([[speed skating]]) *[[Vladimir Salnikov]] ([[swimming (sport)|swimming]]) ==External links== *{{ru icon}} [http://www.hrono.ru/heraldicum/flagi/USSRspor.htm Sport Flags of the USSR] {{Sports Societies of the Soviet Union}} [[Category:Multi-sport clubs in Russia]] [[Category:Sport societies in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:1936 establishments in the Soviet Union]] {{USSR-sport-stub}}
